object.name: MessageEntity
object.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.
object.html_description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.
object.rst_description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

annotations.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be 'mention' (@username), 'hashtag' (#hashtag), 'cashtag' ($USD), 'bot_command' (/start@jobs_bot), 'url' (https://telegram.org), 'email' (do-not-reply@telegram.org), 'phone_number' (+1-212-555-0123), 'bold' (bold text), 'italic' (italic text), 'underline' (underlined text), 'strikethrough' (strikethrough text), 'spoiler' (spoiler message), 'code' (monowidth string), 'pre' (monowidth block), 'text_link' (for clickable text URLs), 'text_mention' (for users without usernames), 'custom_emoji' (for inline custom emoji stickers)
annotations.html_description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames), “custom_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)
annotations.rst_description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be 'mention' (:code:`@username`), 'hashtag' (:code:`#hashtag`), 'cashtag' (:code:`$USD`), 'bot_command' (:code:`/start@jobs_bot`), 'url' (:code:`https://telegram.org`), 'email' (:code:`do-not-reply@telegram.org`), 'phone_number' (:code:`+1-212-555-0123`), 'bold' (**bold text**), 'italic' (*italic text*), 'underline' (underlined text), 'strikethrough' (strikethrough text), 'spoiler' (spoiler message), 'code' (monowidth string), 'pre' (monowidth block), 'text_link' (for clickable text URLs), 'text_mention' (for users `without usernames <https://telegram.org/blog/edit#new-mentions>`_), 'custom_emoji' (for inline custom emoji stickers)
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity
annotations.html_description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity
annotations.rst_description: Offset in `UTF-16 code units <https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length>`_ to the start of the entity
annotations.name: offset

annotations.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units
annotations.html_description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units
annotations.rst_description: Length of the entity in `UTF-16 code units <https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length>`_
annotations.name: length

annotations.description: For 'text_link' only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text
annotations.html_description: Optional. For “text_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. For 'text_link' only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text
annotations.name: url

annotations.description: For 'pre' only, the programming language of the entity text
annotations.html_description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. For 'pre' only, the programming language of the entity text
annotations.name: language

annotations.description: For 'custom_emoji' only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker
annotations.html_description: Optional. For “custom_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. For 'custom_emoji' only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use :class:`aiogram.methods.get_custom_emoji_stickers.GetCustomEmojiStickers` to get full information about the sticker
annotations.name: custom_emoji_id
